acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists

carcinogenicity.rationale: There is no data about this product. A water-soluble barium compounds (ACGIH-TLV, 2006) are equivalent to out of Category (A4), but the carcinogenicity evaluation of platinum salts is not sufficient (EHC (J), 125, 1991). So it cannot be classified due to insufficient data.

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Test methods applicable to solid substances are not available.

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_solids.rationale: Not classified because it is considered as non-combustible substances structurally

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Without data. In addition, in CICAD (J)61 (2004) and PIM G003 (WHO/ICPS, 1997), it is supposed that there is no mutagenic in a cyanide.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Inorganic compounds containing no oxygen and halogen.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Not classified because it is considered as Non-combustible substances structurally

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: There is no this product data, and although the description that "cyanide induces adverse effect against development only by the given dose or concentration which has toxicity in dam clearly" exists in CICAD (J) 61(2004). Since data is insufficient, it cannot be classified.

respiratory_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause allergy or asthma symptoms or breathing difficulties if inhaled
respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: Although there was no data for this substance, water-soluble platinum salt was classified as Category 1 according to Japan Society for Occupational Health advice (2005). Since platinum was indicated as the respiratory allergic substance by the Japanese Society of Occupational Allergy meeting, we classified it to be Category 1.

self_heating_substances.rationale: Not classified because it is considered as non-combustible substances structurally

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: There is no this product data. But in ACGIH-TLV (2006), the water-soluble barium compounds irritates to the eye. There are the descriptions that barium (107 EHC (J), 1990) shows severe eye irritation, cyanide (61 CICAD (J), 2004) shows slight eye irritation, and platinum compound (125 EHC (J), 1991) shows eye irritation. From the above information, it is difficult to be subdivide, and it was classified into Category 2A-2B.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: There is no data of this product. But the water-soluble barium compounds are supposed to indicate skin irritation (ACGIH-TLV (2006)). Since there is description that each of barium (107 EHC (J), 1990) and cyanide (61 CICAD (J), 2004) indicate mild skin irritations, it  was set to Category 3.

skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: May cause an allergic skin reaction
skin_sensitizer.rationale: Although there is no data of this substance, water-soluble platinum salt is classified into 1 according to Association of Industrial Health (2005). Since platinum was used as the skin sensitization by the Japanese Society of Occupational Allergy, it was set to Category 1.

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Stable to water. (As for tetrahydrate of this substance, aqueous solubility values is acquired.)

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (central nervous system)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Although there was no data about this product, we classified it into Category 1(central nervous system) based on the description that repeated exposure of cyanide affects the central nervous systems (CICAD(J)61 (2004; Priority 1 document)).

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification: Category 1 (cardiovascular system, respiratory system, central nervous system, skeletal muscle)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Causes damage to organs (cardiovascular system, respiratory system, central nervous system, skeletal muscle)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There are no data for this substance. But the cardio-vascular system, respiratory system and central nervous system are listed as the target organs of the acute toxicity of the cyanide (CICAD (J),  61, 2004), and the cardio-vascular system and skeletal muscle as the target organs of the aqueous barium compound (possibly the effect of hypokalemia). The substance was classified as Category 1 (cardio-vascular system, respiratory system, central nervous system, skeletal muscle) because each source reference is a Priority 1 document.
